lu.uni.lassy.excalibur.examples.icrash.dev.java.system

Interface IcrashSystem

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    IcrashSystemImpl

    public interface IcrashSystem
extends java.rmi.Remote
    The Interface IcrashSystem that allows RMI access to the server methods.

    • Method Detail

      • doTest

        void doTest()
     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Do test.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if the server is offline

      • setCurrentRequestingAuthenticatedActor

        void setCurrentRequestingAuthenticatedActor(ActAuthenticated aActAuthenticated)
                                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Sets the current requesting authenticated actor on the server. This is the current user accessing the server and doing functions. This is called by the actor themselves and must be set before calling a modification method
        Parameters:
        aActAuthenticated - the new current requesting authenticated actor
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if the server is offline

        Gets the current requesting authenticated actor that was set by the server side actor.
        Returns:
        the current requesting authenticated actor
        Throws:

      • getActComCompany

        ActComCompany getActComCompany(java.lang.String name)
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Gets the specified communication company with the name specified.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the company to retrieve
        Returns:
        If an actor communication company was found, send it back. Otherwise retun null
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if the server is offline

      • oeCreateSystemAndEnvironment

        PtBoolean oeCreateSystemAndEnvironment(PtInteger aQtyComCompanies)
                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Creates the system and environment on the system.
        Parameters:
        aQtyComCompanies - The quantity of communication companies to create. This can only be a maximum of 4, if you want more, you need to add more to the Enumeration ComCompaniesInLux
        Returns:
        The success of the method
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if the server is offline

      • oeAlert

        PtBoolean oeAlert(EtHumanKind aEtHumanKind,
                  DtDate aDtDate,
                  DtTime aDtTime,
                  DtPhoneNumber aDtPhoneNumber,
                  DtGPSLocation aDtGPSLocation,
                  DtComment aDtComment)
           throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Creates an alert in the system using the parameters passed Uses the actor communication company for this method.
        Parameters:
        aEtHumanKind - The kind of human reporting the accident
        aDtDate - The date of the accident
        aDtTime - The time of the accident
        aDtPhoneNumber - The phone number of the human reporting the accident
        aDtGPSLocation - The location of the accident
        aDtComment - The message sent by the user
        Returns:
        The success of the method
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if the server is offline

      • oeSollicitateCrisisHandling

        PtBoolean oeSollicitateCrisisHandling()
                               throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Runs the function of sollicitating crisis handling, if a crisis hasn't been handled with the delay, coordinators will be warned. If it passes max delax, it will be auto assigned out
        Returns:
        The success of the method
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Thrown if the server is offline

        Returns:
